comments.body: I would suggest around half of the levels you died with.
There could be an exp orb lying around that is player-owned. If a different player collects it, he only gets the 7 levels. If the original player manages to reach it, he gets 57 - 7 = 50 levels back.
Ooooo. That's makes sense.

I think that instead of deactivating the shield, you should be very slow, even to just to turn your camera. So a mob could just walk around you and hit you

"Then I get sad because I only tame the horses that jump high and run fast, "

Horses have a balance for this reason. Slower but more health, or faster with less health. 

 

"I also think you should be able to see how many hearts a pet has when you move your mouse or finger over the pet."

That's actually a good idea. You can tell a wolfs HP by looking at the tail and a horse/pig by riding them, but that's about it.

I think you should be able to choose when your pet cat or dog teleports. and they should teleport from farther away. I lost my cat because I was flying to fast. I don't know if it was sitting or not but I think we should choose (if the cat is sitting down or dog) if the cat teleports and we should be able to teleports to our pets if we loose them

This is not a thing in Java.
You hold fly and crouch a the same time.
I like the idea, and think it should be across all Minecraft. Maybe there could be an extra toggle or button while flying for touch controls and a mappable button for controllers/keyboards.
They should split the controls fly down and crouch in the control mapping settings. This would let you map, for example, circle/B to fly down and R3/RS to crouch.

Think of this:

Can you put plastic cups inside plastic cups? Probably yes

Can you put plastic cups in plastic cups filled with water? No
But you can stack stone blocks on each other and that's not possible in real life either

Pretty good idea! I definitely think that potions need another reason to be widely used, so first off, I completely agree that this is an important problem.

There's nothing wrong with your idea, but I'd like to offer an alternative: in my post Make cauldrons, potions, and soups more useful, I propose making all potions stack to 4, with a small cooldown for splash potions. I think that this is good enough to make potions more useful, and I think that the timings of potions are pretty well balanced already.

Thanks for posting! It was a good read.
I definitely think potions should be made stackable (at least in stacks of 3) as I agree that you have to go through so much effort for them for such little reward.

I think a good way to make potions more useful would be to keep the base effects the same, but then allow certain potions to be combined or brewed together to make more powerful potions. Beacon effects invalidate the most common potions, but making more powerful potions could balance potions against beacons: beacons would be less powerful but would be permanent, and potions would be more powerful but temporary. Two potion could be combined with a piece of glowstone dust to make a potion that is one level more powerful. For example, combining two speed potions could make a speed potion with +10% more bonus. Two +40% speed potions would yield a +50% speed potion, and two +50% potions would yield a +60% potion. This would make it possible to make more powerful potions, but make each new level exponentially more difficult to get. This would mean it would take 4 speed II potions to get a +60% speed potion, and 64 speed II potions to make a +100% speed potion. This could also work with strength, jump boost, healing, damage, and maybe poison and regeneration. For the other potions it would be inapplicable or too powerful or too convoluted.

The functionality for this could be that if there are two layers of potion that can be combined in a cauldron, then right-clicking with a piece of glowstone dust on it will combine them.

Potions effects should be able to be added into food items in Minecraft

Potions should be able to be infused into food as you are unable to make a person just drink any potion which does damage to you, so it will make sense as then it would make poison and harming potions more effective at what they can do, you can even apply this with other potion effects.

Yes, the little dots on the bar should simply be a transparent overlay on the regular XP bar so that you can easily still see your levels below even if you're not actively collecting XP. Here is a quick concept of this that I made:

There is also a post about this here: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/34967992635405

Something like this would be really cool! I think it should apply to all blocks mined with a Fire Aspect pickaxe, so wet sponges mined with it would become dry, and stone would come up as smooth stone.

"ReducedDebugInfo is already in the game, but for some reason is not on by default (even though it clearly should be)?"
In real life people also don't have coordinates, can spoof bases through pie charts, the F3 just ruin big servers

To encourage people to not use F3, and to offload the impact of removing F3 for people who rely on it, maps should have grids similar to the latitude and longitude on real maps that display static coordinates in multiples of 64.
